title: The best games of the year for people who like to win
summary: Cavern Co-op is a thematic, story-driven co-op game in which you and your team of “caver” buddies explore a dark and dangerous cave. The game can be played with 2-4 people and only takes about 45 minutes. The Bigger Game is a card game for 2-8 people that has you competing to build a bigger, better board game. Eclipse is a game about managing your ship and crew as you try to survive an extremely dangerous galaxy.

Your goal is to collect crystals and escape the cave, but that\u2019s easier said than done."),mdx("p",null,"The catch is that you\u2019re in a race against the clock. After an hour of play, you\u2019ll hear an ominous rumble in the background. The \u201Ctime bomb\u201D is activated, and you have 30 minutes to finish the game before it blows up."),mdx("p",null,"This is a great game for anyone who loves narrative-heavy games with high stakes. It\u2019s easy to learn and plays well with 2-4 friends. Best of all, Cavern Co-op is extremely moddable. You can find tons of fan-made rule-changes and expansions online to keep this game fresh."),mdx("h2",null,"Tiny Epic Mechs"),mdx("p",null,"Tiny Epic Mechs is a game about building a team of super-powered heroes and taking on a team of evil robots. It\u2019s a game about managing resources and making tough decisions. It\u2019s a game about winning."),mdx("p",null,"The game can be played with 2-4 people and only takes about 45 minutes. There\u2019s a ton of value here for the price. Seriously, this game is tiny, but it\u2019s also epic."),mdx("p",null,"Some people think that games should be easy to learn, but not at the expense of depth. This game can be played casually, but it\u2019s also extremely competitive. The team at Game Covenant who created Tiny Epic Mechs really knows how to pack a punch in a tiny box."),mdx("h2",null,"The Bigger Game"),mdx("p",null,"The Bigger Game is a card game for 2-8 people that has you competing to build a bigger, better board game. However, it\u2019s also tons of fun and can be played with a wide range of skill levels. You can even play completely cutthroat if you\u2019re so inclined."),mdx("p",null,"The Bigger Game can be a little goofy at times, but it\u2019s also challenging and tons of fun. It\u2019s a great game for larger groups, and it can also be played competitively if you\u2019re so inclined. This is a game for board game nerds who like to have fun."),mdx("h2",null,"Broom Service: The Card Game"),mdx("p",null,"Broom Service is a game about managing your staff and making sure there are enough witches and wizards available to keep your customers happy. It\u2019s a game about resource management and carefully choosing how to spend your time and energy as a manager. It\u2019s a game about winning."),mdx("p",null,"This is a very different game from Tiny Epic Mechs, but they both have something to offer different types of gamers. Broom Service is simpler than Mechs, but it\u2019s also more challenging. It\u2019s a great card game for people who like to have something to think about when they play."),mdx("p",null,"Like Tiny Epic Mechs, Broom Service is tiny but packed with value. It\u2019s a great game for people who are looking for something a little different from the standard deck building game. It\u2019s a great game for people who like to have something to think about when they play."),mdx("h2",null,"Darkness Comes: A Game of Heroes and Skirmish"),mdx("p",null,"Darkness Comes is a game of heroes, villains, and skirmishes. You\u2019ll build a team of heroes (or villains) to skirmish against other players. What\u2019s great about this game is that it can be played completely casually and cooperatively, or you can play to win."),mdx("p",null,"This game is incredibly flexible, and it can be played with almost any group of friends. It\u2019s a very easy game to learn and understand. Anyone who likes competition and cooperation will love this game."),mdx("p",null,"This is a great game for people who want something accessible but with a lot of depth and variety. It\u2019s also a great game for people who like fantasy and RPG themes."),mdx("h2",null,"Eclipse \u2013 The Codex RPG"),mdx("p",null,"Eclipse is a game about space exploration, diplomacy, and combat. It\u2019s a game about managing your ship and crew as you try to survive an extremely dangerous galaxy. It\u2019s a game about winning."),mdx("p",null,"Eclipse is a very complex game, and it\u2019s not for everyone. There are lots of rules and systems. However, if you\u2019re a fan of sci-fi, you owe it to yourself to try this game. Eclipse is a very different type of game. It\u2019s a great game for people who like a challenge and intrigue."),mdx("p",null,"This is a great game for people who like complexity, sci-fi, and intrigue. It\u2019s not the easiest game to learn, but the payoff is worth the effort. This is a great game for people who like a challenge and intrigue."),mdx("h2",null,"Munchkin Adventure Time 2 \u2013 Be More and DO More!"),mdx("p",null,"Munchkin is a very silly game about being the first person to get ten \u201Clevels\u201D and defeat the \u201Cbad guy.\u201D It\u2019s a game about bluffing, cheating, and being outrageously over the top. It\u2019s a game about winning."),mdx("p",null,"If you\u2019ve ever wanted to play a game where you can team up with friends to take down monstrous rats while also stealing their stuff and stabbing them in the back, then Munchkin is for you. This game is stupid, but it\u2019s also tons of fun."),mdx("p",null,"This is a great game for people who are interested in tabletop games but are a little too concerned with being serious to try them. relatedArticles.title: The Best Games of the Year for Adults
The Best Games of the Year for Everyone

intro.compiledSource:
var y=Object.defineProperty,l=Object.defineProperties;var u=Object.getOwnPropertyDescriptors;var n=Object.getOwnPropertySymbols;var s=Object.prototype.hasOwnProperty,h=Object.prototype.propertyIsEnumerable;var i=(e,t,a)=>t in e?y(e,t,{enumerable:!0,configurable:!0,writable:!0,value:a}):e[t]=a,r=(e,t)=>{for(var a in t||(t={}))s.call(t,a)&&i(e,a,t[a]);if(n)for(var a of n(t))h.call(t,a)&&i(e,a,t[a]);return e},m=(e,t)=>l(e,u(t));var p=(e,t)=>{var a={};for(var o in e)s.call(e,o)&&t.indexOf(o)<0&&(a[o]=e[o]);if(e!=null&&n)for(var o of n(e))t.indexOf(o)<0&&h.call(e,o)&&(a[o]=e[o]);return a};const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent(a){var o=a,{components:e}=o,t=p(o,["components"]);return mdx(MDXLayout,m(r(r({},layoutProps),t),{components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"}),mdx("p",null,`If you\u2019re interested in video games, you have probably heard that 2018 was a great year for gaming. It was. But it wasn\u2019t just this past year\u2014gaming has been on the upswing for a while now. There are more gamers playing more games than ever before, and it\u2019s an exciting time to be part of this culture.
There are so many excellent video games released every month that it can be overwhelming to keep track of them all. That\u2019s why we\u2019ve compiled a list of what we think are the best new games from the last few months of 2018 that everyone should play if they get the opportunity:`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: The Worst Games of the Year

intro.compiledSource:
var d=Object.defineProperty,m=Object.defineProperties;var y=Object.getOwnPropertyDescriptors;var i=Object.getOwnPropertySymbols;var s=Object.prototype.hasOwnProperty,r=Object.prototype.propertyIsEnumerable;var l=(e,t,o)=>t in e?d(e,t,{enumerable:!0,configurable:!0,writable:!0,value:o}):e[t]=o,a=(e,t)=>{for(var o in t||(t={}))s.call(t,o)&&l(e,o,t[o]);if(i)for(var o of i(t))r.call(t,o)&&l(e,o,t[o]);return e},h=(e,t)=>m(e,y(t));var c=(e,t)=>{var o={};for(var n in e)s.call(e,n)&&t.indexOf(n)<0&&(o[n]=e[n]);if(e!=null&&i)for(var n of i(e))t.indexOf(n)<0&&r.call(e,n)&&(o[n]=e[n]);return o};const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent(o){var n=o,{components:e}=n,t=c(n,["components"]);return mdx(MDXLayout,h(a(a({},layoutProps),t),{components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"}),mdx("p",null,`The video game industry is filled with great games. These are also some of the most challenging and difficult ones to make. Cracking the code on how to build a well-crafted and engaging video game requires practice, ingenuity, skill, and patience. But not every developer is up to the task. Some simply fail at creating an entertaining experience for players. This list compiles some of the disappointments from 2018 that failed to meet an acceptable standard of quality.
These are the worst games of 2018, broken down by category and listed in no particular order. Some might have had good intentions or interesting concepts, but fell short in their execution. If you\u2019re looking for something new to play this year, stay away from these titles as they won\u2019t give you your money\u2019s worth or much satisfaction beyond finishing them once (if that).`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

The Best Games of the Year for Kids

In fact, the market for kids games has grown so much that there is now a range of specialist games developers who only make games targeted at this audience. The release of new gaming devices such as the Nintendo Switch, Google Stadia and the Xbox Scarlett has also led to a renewed interest in kid-friendly games from parents and other adult gamers. Here we have put together our favorite kid-friendly video games that you can play at home with your child or let them play on their own to help develop their skills."))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: The Best Games of the Year for Partygoers
The Best Games of the Year for Solitaire Players

intro.compiledSource:
var m=Object.defineProperty,u=Object.defineProperties;var g=Object.getOwnPropertyDescriptors;var s=Object.getOwnPropertySymbols;var r=Object.prototype.hasOwnProperty,l=Object.prototype.propertyIsEnumerable;var n=(e,a,t)=>a in e?m(e,a,{enumerable:!0,configurable:!0,writable:!0,value:t}):e[a]=t,i=(e,a)=>{for(var t in a||(a={}))r.call(a,t)&&n(e,t,a[t]);if(s)for(var t of s(a))l.call(a,t)&&n(e,t,a[t]);return e},h=(e,a)=>u(e,g(a));var y=(e,a)=>{var t={};for(var o in e)r.call(e,o)&&a.indexOf(o)<0&&(t[o]=e[o]);if(e!=null&&s)for(var o of s(e))a.indexOf(o)<0&&l.call(e,o)&&(t[o]=e[o]);return t};const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent(t){var o=t,{components:e}=o,a=y(o,["components"]);return mdx(MDXLayout,h(i(i({},layoutProps),a),{components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"}),mdx("p",null,`There are a million and one ways to play solitaire. The rules may be simple, but there is actually so much strategy involved that it\u2019s almost like learning a whole new game every time you sit down to play. If you enjoy playing solitaire games as much as we do, then you\u2019ll probably also agree that there are a lot of different variations of the game itself as well. Some versions of solitaire require skill, luck, and a little bit of patience all at once.
These top rated games are some of the most fun and engaging ways to play this classic card game. Whether you prefer an easy version with higher rewards or something more strategic and challenging, these solitaire games will keep your interest from start to finish!`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: The Best Games of the Year for Families

Gaming is a wonderful way for families to connect and have fun together. Many parents worry that kids who play video games for long periods of time are not interacting with other people enough. But the truth is, there are lots of great family-friendly video games out there that can be an enjoyable part of your kid\u2019s life.
We present you with the best family-friendly games released in 2018: Word games, puzzles and board games. These are some of the most engaging titles we\u2019ve played all year long. These are not educational or just slightly wholesome\u2014these are the best family-friendly games released this year that we think everyone should own as soon as possible!`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: The Top 5 Games of the Year

We spend lots of time playing them, talking about them with friends and family, thinking about them and even dreaming about them. The games we play also reflect who we are as individuals. They serve as a mirror that reflects back an image of our unique personalities. Each one of us has different preferences and taste in games. There\u2019s also a lot to choose from, too: There are so many video games today that no individual can ever hope to try them all. That said, there are some great ones out there and they come in all shapes and sizes: Action-adventure, shooters, RPGs; you name it! Here is a list of the top 5 games this year that you must play if you haven\u2019t already:"))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;
